item.title: ctrlp.vim
item.description:
Full path fuzzy file, buffer, mru, tag, ... finder for Vim.

Link

item.title: What is the maximum Bandwidth? - Sixty Symbols
item.description:
Wonderful explanation of bandwidth limit and its relation to the uncertainity principle.

Link

item.title: Ceylon - Programming language
item.description:
Interesting JVM/JS target programming language

Link

item.title: Feynman Lectures on Physics : Vol 1
item.description:
Nicely compiled HTML pages of lectures by Richard Feynman. Volume 1 is "mainly mechanics, radiation, and heat"

Link

item.title: Flat Pixels: The Battle Between Flat Design and Skewmorphism
item.description:
Good Article on recent shift towards flatter UI and logos

Link

item.title: Reversible Computing
item.description:
Reversible computing is study of computing models where computation is reversible in a physical and logical sense. Reversible computing could improve energy efficiency of computers beyond the theoretical limits of present day reversible models of computation.

Link

item.title: Clojure Documentation
item.description:
Community driven documentation for Clojure. Contains Guides, Tutorials, cookbooks etc.

Link

item.title: Crystal: Programming Language
item.description:
Interesting compile-to-native programming language with ruby like syntax, C bindings support. Interesting type inference system with a union type.

Link

item.title: Chirptune: Javascript music composer
item.description:
Javascript composer for chirp tunes, with programmable sounds.

Link

item.title: ShareLaTeX: Online LaTeX Editor
item.description:
Full fledged LaTex editor in browser with preview. Includes templates for different kinds of documents. No live update for preview :(

Link

item.title: Tessel: Javascript microcontroller
item.description:
Tessel is an Internet-connected microcontroller for software developers. Tessel runs JavaScript right on the deviceâ€”no server necessary. Use your own IDE and libraries to program it, just like web development. Uploading new firmware is as easy as tessel push!

Link

item.title: K2pdfopt: PDF to Kindle tool
item.description:
Excellent commandline tool to optimize PDFs for viewing in kindle. Nicely optimizes 2 column layout in academic publications. Also comes with OCR support, which enables text selection and annotation in the optimized PDF (though the conversion becomes significantly slower). Available for Linux, Windows and Mac.

Link

item.title: Clay Shirky: How the Internet will (one day) transform government
item.description:
TED Talk by Clay Shirky, where he discusses how the open source code development model could transform law making, democratic process.

Link

item.title: altJS - Web coding without javascript
item.description:
A Comprehensive list of compile-to-javascript languages and other projects that tries to enhance/fix things in javascript.

Link

item.title: Hakyll - Haskell library for generating static sites
item.description:
Hakyll is a Haskell library for generating static sites, mostly aimed at small-to-medium sites and personal blogs. It is written in a very configurable way and uses an xmonad-like DSL for configuration.

Link

item.title: HoTT - A textbook on informal homotopy type theory
item.description:
Open source book on Homotopy type theory.

In mathematical logic and computer science, homotopy type theory (HoTT) attempts to give an account of the semantics of intensional type theory using the framework of (abstract) homotopy theory

Link

item.title: prose.io - A content editor for github
item.description:
Excellent tool for managing static websites hosted on github. Should go really well with jstatic

Prose provides a beatifully simple content authoring environment for CMS-free websites. It's a web-based interface for managing content on GitHub. Use it to create, edit, and delete files, and save your changes directly to GitHub. Host your website on GitHub Pages for free, or set up your own GitHub webhook server.

Link

item.title: Daim - graffiti-art
item.description:
Amazing graffiti art.

Form is created by a few lines, colour becomes an emotion, and shapes reminiscient of architectural elements grow and extend into space. Still plains contrast with dynamic elements which divide and cut across the image.

Link

item.title: Coursera-dl - Coursera download script
item.description:
Python script that downloads course videos, lectures etc from Coursera.

Link

item.title: The Future of Programming
item.description:
Interesting video by Bret Victor, on forgotten ideas in PL design. Funny, how he comes on stage as an engineer from the 70s.

Link
